I'm currently reviewing this pull request and will post my feedback shortly. In the meantime, here's a summary to help you and other reviewers quickly get up to speed!\n\nThis pull request introduces a significant new feature to the SheepVibes application, allowing users to dynamically modify the URLs of their RSS feed widgets. This enhancement provides greater flexibility and control over their personalized news feeds, moving beyond static feed configurations. The changes span both the backend, with a new API endpoint for updates, and the frontend, with an intuitive user interface for editing, ensuring a robust and user-friendly experience.\n\n### Highlights\n\n* **Editable Feed URLs**: Users can now edit feed URLs directly from the frontend UI, providing greater flexibility in managing their RSS feeds.\n* **Backend API Extension**: A new `PUT /api/feeds/` endpoint has been added to the backend for updating feed URLs and properties, including robust validation and automatic name/site link updates.\n* **Interactive Frontend**: Each feed widget now features an edit button (✎) that opens a modal dialog for URL editing, complete with form validation and automatic feed refresh upon successful update.\n* **CORS Configuration**: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) has been configured on the backend to enable seamless communication with the frontend, especially when running on different ports or domains.\n* **Comprehensive Testing**: New unit tests have been added for the `PUT` endpoint, ensuring the reliability and correctness of the feed update functionality.\n* **Documentation Updates**: The `CHANGELOG.md` and `TODO.md` files have been updated to reflect the new feature and completed development tasks.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\nUsing Gemini Code Assist\n
\n\nThe full guide for Gemini Code Assist can be found on our [documentation page](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/review-github-code), here are some quick tips.\n\nInvoking Gemini\n\nYou can request assistance from Gemini at any point by creating a comment using either `/gemini ` or `@gemini-code-assist `. Below is a summary of the supported commands on the current page.\n\nFeature | Command | Description\n--- | --- | ---\nCode Review | `/gemini review` | Performs a code review for the current pull request in its current state.\nPull Request Summary | `/gemini summary` | Provides a summary of the current pull request in its current state.\nComment | @gemini-code-assist | Responds in comments when explicitly tagged, both in pull request comments and review comments.\nHelp | `/gemini help` | Displays a list of available commands.\n\nCustomization\n\nTo customize Gemini Code Assist for GitHub experience, repository maintainers can create a configuration file and/or provide a custom code review style guide (such as PEP-8 for Python) by creating and adding files to a `.gemini/` folder in the base of the repository. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github).\n\nLimitations & Feedback\n\nGemini Code Assist may make mistakes. Please leave feedback on any instances where its feedback is incorrect or counter productive. You can react with :thumbsup: and :thumbsdown: on @gemini-code-assist comments. Content truncated. Call the fetch tool with a start_index of 5000 to get more content.", "annotations": null}], "isError": false}

+584,106 @@ document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {\n         }\n     }\n \n+    // --- Edit Feed Logic ---\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Handles the click event for a feed widget's edit button.\n+     * @param {number} feedId - The ID of the feed to edit.\n+     * @param {string} currentUrl - The current URL of the feed.\n+     * @param {string} currentName - The current name of the feed.\n+     */\n+    function handleEditFeed(feedId, currentUrl, currentName) {\n+        console.log(`Editing feed: ${feedId}`);\n+        \n+        const modal = document.getElementById('edit-feed-modal');\n+        const feedIdInput = document.getElementById('edit-feed-id');\n+        const feedUrlInput = document.getElementById('edit-feed-url');\n+        const feedNameInput = document.getElementById('edit-feed-name');\n+        \n+        // Populate the form with current values\n+        feedIdInput.value = feedId;\n+        feedUrlInput.value = currentUrl;\n+        feedNameInput.value = currentName;\n+        \n+        // Show the modal\n+        modal.style.display = 'flex';\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Handles the submission of the edit feed form.\n+     * @param {Event} event - The form submission event.\n+     */\n+    async function handleEditFeedSubmit(event) {\n+        event.preventDefault();\n+        \n+        const modal = document.getElementById('edit-feed-modal');\n+        const feedIdInput = document.getElementById('edit-feed-id');\n+        const feedUrlInput = document.getElementById('edit-feed-url');\n+        const saveButton = document.getElementById('save-feed-button');\n+        \n+        const feedId = parseInt(feedIdInput.value);\n+        const newUrl = feedUrlInput.value.trim();\n+        \n+        if (!newUrl) {\n+            alert('Please enter a feed URL');\n+            return;\n+        }\n+        \n+        // Disable the save button and show loading state\n+        const originalButtonText = saveButton.textContent;\n+        saveButton.disabled = true;\n+        saveButton.textContent = 'Saving...';\n+        \n+        try {\n+            const result = await fetchData(`/api/feeds/${feedId}`, {\n+                method: 'PUT',\n+                headers: {\n+                    'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n+                },\n+                body: JSON.stringify({ url: newUrl })\n+            });\n+            \n+            if (result) {\n+                console.log('Feed updated successfully:', result);\n+                // Close the modal\n+                modal.style.display = 'none';\n+                \n+                // Update just the edited widget instead of reloading entire tab\n+                const widget = document.querySelector(`.feed-widget[data-feed-id=\"${feedId}\"]`);\n+                if (widget) {\n+                    // Replace the widget with updated content\n+                    const newWidget =
